name: UpdateTimeEntry
description:
Update the details of a time entry.

This tool updates specific details of a time entry in ClickUp. Use it when you need to modify data such as the duration, description, or other attributes of an existing time entry.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The Workspace ID is required when referencing a task by its custom task ID. Provide it if `custom_task_ids` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace (team) where the time entry is located. This is an integer value.

parameters.name: timer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the time entry to be updated.

parameters.name: time_entry_details
parameters.description: Details for updating the time entry, including description, tags, start, end times, and other attributes.

tags.description: Users on the Business Plan and above can include a time tracking label.

start.description: When providing `start`, you must also provide `end`.

end.description: When providing `end`, you must also provide `start`.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference tasks by custom task IDs instead of standard IDs.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`

tags.description: Users on the Business Plan and above can include a time tracking label.

start.description: When providing `start`, you must also provide `end`.

end.description: When providing `end`, you must also provide `start`.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
